Playbooks.Name: Mechanic
Playbooks.Hook: A gearhead and hacker. Play a Mechanic if you want to make new devices, keep your ship in good shape, or hack systems.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Bailing Wire and Mech-Tape
SpecialAbilities.Description: You get an extra downtime activity to repair, and the repair activity costs you 0 cred.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Construct Whisperer
SpecialAbilities.Description: Machines speak to you when you study them. The first time you roll a critical while fixing or building a particular machine, you may add a simple modification to it.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Junkyard Hunter
SpecialAbilities.Description: When you acquire parts or equipment during downtime, you may either gain two assets or one asset at +1 quality.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Hacker
SpecialAbilities.Description: You may expend your special armor to resist the consequences of hacking, or to push yourself when hacking or gathering info electronically.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Fixed
SpecialAbilities.Description: You may expend your special armor to resist a consequence from machines breaking or being damaged, or to push yourself when repairing or building a machine.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Mechanic's Heart
SpecialAbilities.Description: When you speak from your heart, your words can reach even the most hardened criminal, and you gain potency.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Overclock
SpecialAbilities.Description: When you spend a gambit on a rig roll to repair or upgrade, treat the system you worked on as 1 quality higher for the remainder of the job.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Analyst
SpecialAbilities.Description: When you hack a system, you may also ask a question about the owner or location of the system as though you had rolled a 6 ongather info. When you resist the consequences of hacking, roll +1d.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Veteran
SpecialAbilities.Description: Choose a special ability from another source

Rolodex.Name: Colorful Friends
Friends: Stev, a gambler of ill repute

Playbooks.ExperienceCondition: You address challenges with technical skill or ingenuity

Playbooks.Name: Muscle
Playbooks.Hook: Muscles are good at winning fights. Play a Muscle if you want to be unstoppable in combat.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Wrecking Crew
SpecialAbilities.Description: Your strength and ferocity are infamous. When striking in melee, you gain +1d. Whenever you spend a gambit in combat, you also gain +1 effect on that action.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Backup
SpecialAbilities.Description: An ally s push costs 1 stress (not 2) on any action you set up or assist.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Battleborn
SpecialAbilities.Description: You may expend your special armor to reduce harm from an attack in combat, or to push yourself during a fight.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Bodyguard
SpecialAbilities.Description: When you protect a crewmate, resist with +1d. When you take harm, clear 1 stress

SpecialAbilities.Name: Flesh Wound
SpecialAbilities.Description: If you re wounded at the beginning of downtime, mark +3 segments on your healing clock. When you push yourself to ignore wound penalties, it takes only 1 stress (not 2).

SpecialAbilities.Name: Predator
SpecialAbilities.Description: Take +1d to rolls against weakened or vulnerable targets.Whenever you gather information on a weakness or vulnerability, the worst you can get is a 4-5 result.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Ready For Anything
SpecialAbilities.Description: When being ambushed, you gain potency to all actions during a flashback, and your first flashback costs 0 stress.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Scary
SpecialAbilities.Description: You have an air of menace and danger obvious to even the most unobservant. You gain potency when trying to intimidate someone. If done immediately after a show of force, also take +1d.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Veteran
SpecialAbilities.Description: Choose a special ability from another source

Playbooks.ExperienceCondition: You addressed a challenge with force or threats.

Playbooks.Name: Mystic
Playbooks.Hook: A galactic wanderer, in touch with the Way. Play one if you want to use artifacts and weird powers.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Kinetics
SpecialAbilities.Description: You can push yourself to do one of the following: use The Way to throw a table-sized object with dangerous force or propel yourself briefly with superhuman speed.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Psy-Blade
SpecialAbilities.Description: You can focus Way energy into your melee weapon. While charged, the weapon can cut through non-shielded materials with ease, and you gain potency on your melee attacks.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Center
SpecialAbilities.Description: You gain Meditation as a vice. When you indulge this vice, clear +1 stress and add Dark Visions as a possible overindulgence

SpecialAbilities.Name: Way Shield
SpecialAbilities.Description: You can block blaster bolts with The Way (resist with resolve). If you resist a blaster attack, you may spend 1 stress to redirect fire and make an attack of your own with it.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Warded
SpecialAbilities.Description: You may expend your special armor to resist the consequences of a Way attack or artifact use, or push yourself when using mystic powers.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Psy-Dancing
SpecialAbilities.Description: You may push yourself to cloud a target s mind and sway them in the face of contradictory evidence. Spend 1 stress for each additional feature: they have only vague memories of the event and/or it works on a small group.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Visions
SpecialAbilities.Description: Spend 1 stress to remotely view a distant place or person tied to you in some intimate way. Spend 1 stress for each extra feature: it lasts for a minute rather than a moment and/or your target can also see and hear you and/or you may see something only familiar to you, not intimate.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Sundering
SpecialAbilities.Description: You may push yourself to attune to The Way and twist it, causing psychic harm to anyone in the area vulnerable to your assault. You may spend 1 stress for each additional feature: it damages instead of stuns and/or you and anyone you choose get +2d to resist the effects.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Veteran
SpecialAbilities.Description: Choose a special ability from another source

Playbooks.ExperienceCondition: You addressed a challenge with wisdom or The Way

Playbooks.Name: Pilot
Playbooks.Hook: A ship-handling wizard and danger addict. Play a Pilot if you want to be a daredevil at the wheel and widely traveled.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Keen Eye
SpecialAbilities.Description: You have sharp eyes and notice small details many might overlook. Gain +1d when firing ship guns or making trick shots.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Side Job
SpecialAbilities.Description: You may spend a downtime activity in port doing odd jobs. Gain 1 cred. If there are rumors floating about, the GM will tell you of them.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Exceed Specs
SpecialAbilities.Description: While onboard a ship, you may damage a ship system you have access to in order to gain +1d or +1 effect to a roll.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Leaf On The Wind
SpecialAbilities.Description: When you push yourself, you may spend +1 stress (3 stress total) to gain both +1 effect and +1d instead of one or the other.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Hedonist
SpecialAbilities.Description: When you indulge your vice, you may adjust the dice outcome by +/-2. An ally who joins you may do the same.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Commander
SpecialAbilities.Description: Whenever you lead a group action, gain +1 scale (for example, a small group counts as a medium group). If you lead a group action in combat, you may count multiple 6s from different rolls as a critical.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Traveler
SpecialAbilities.Description: You re comfortable around unusual cultures and xenos. You gain potency when attempting to consort with or sway them.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Punch It!
SpecialAbilities.Description: When you spend a gambit on a desperate roll, it counts as risky instead.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Veteran
SpecialAbilities.Description: Choose a special ability from another source

Playbooks.ExperienceCondition: You addressed a challenge with speed or flair

Playbooks.Name: Scoundrel
Playbooks.Hook: A scrappy and lucky survivor, Scoundrels love getting into and out of trouble. Play a Scoundrel if you want to press your luck.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Never Tell Me The Odds
SpecialAbilities.Description: You generate gambits on desperate rolls. You may also generate gambits even if you spent a gambit.

SpecialAbilities.Name: I Know A Guy
SpecialAbilities.Description: When you first dock at a port after being away, pick one and ask the GM about a job: it s not deadly or it pays well enough or it s not a rush job or it comes from a faction you trust or it targets an enemy you have. You may spend 1 cred per additional feature.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Tenacious
SpecialAbilities.Description: Penalties from harm are one level less severe (though level 4 harm is still fatal).

SpecialAbilities.Name: When The Chips Are Down
SpecialAbilities.Description: You gain a second use of special armor between each downtime.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Devil's Own Luck
SpecialAbilities.Description: You may expend your special armor to resist the consequences of blaster fire, or to push yourself when talking your way out of (or running from) trouble.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Daredevil
SpecialAbilities.Description: When you make a desperate roll, you may take +1d. If you do so, do not mark xp in that action s attribute.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Shoot First
SpecialAbilities.Description: When you attack from hiding or spring a trap, take +1d. When there s a question about who acts first, the answer is you (two characters with Shoot First act simultaneously).

SpecialAbilities.Name: Ask Questions Later
SpecialAbilities.Description: When you consort to gather info, you gain +1 effect and can in addition ask: Who might this benefit?

SpecialAbilities.Name: Veteran
SpecialAbilities.Description: Choose a special ability from another source

Playbooks.ExperienceCondition: You addressed a challenge with charm or audacity

Playbooks.Name: Speaker
Playbooks.Hook: A respectable person on the take. Play a Speaker if you want to be the respectable one and use connections to get your way.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Favors Owed
SpecialAbilities.Description: During downtime, you get +1d when you acquire assets or lay low. Any time you gather info, take +1d.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Player
SpecialAbilities.Description: You always know when someone is lying to you.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Infiltrator
SpecialAbilities.Description: You are not affected by quality or Tier when you bypass security measures.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Subterfuge
SpecialAbilities.Description: You may expend your special armor to resist a consequence of persuasion or suspicion. When you resist with insight, gain +1d.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Heart to Heart
SpecialAbilities.Description: When you provide meaningful insight or heartfelt advice that a crewmate follows, you both clear 1 stress.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Old Friends
SpecialAbilities.Description: Whenever you land in a new location, write down a friend you know there (under Influential Friends on your playbook sheet).

SpecialAbilities.Name: Disarming
SpecialAbilities.Description: Whenever you use a gambit while speaking, hostilities and danger also pause while you speak.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Purpose
SpecialAbilities.Description: You may expend your special armor to push yourself when outclassed by your opposition, or when under the effects of wounds. When you resist with resolve, gain +1d.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Veteran
SpecialAbilities.Description: Choose a special ability from another source.

Playbooks.ExperienceCondition: You addressed a challenge with deception or influence

Playbooks.Name: Stitch
Playbooks.Hook: A spacefaring healer or scientist. Play a Stitch to deal with science, patch people up, and be the crew s moral compass.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Physicker
SpecialAbilities.Description: You may study a malady, wounds, or corpse, and gather info from a crime scene. Also, your crew gets +1d to recovery rolls.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Patch
SpecialAbilities.Description: You may doctor someone during a job to allow them to ignore the effects of a harm penalty.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Welcome Anywhere
SpecialAbilities.Description: While wearing your medic garb, you are welcome even in dangerous places. Gain +1d to consort and sway when offering to tend to anyone in need.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Under Pressure
SpecialAbilities.Description: Add a gambit to the pool whenever you or a crew member suffers level 2 or greater harm.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Combat Medic
SpecialAbilities.Description: You may expend your special armor to resist any consequence while tending to a patient. When you doctor someone in combat, clear 1 stress.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Moral Compass
SpecialAbilities.Description: When you do the right thing at cost to yourself, mark xp (any category).

SpecialAbilities.Name: Dr. Strange
SpecialAbilities.Description: Your research and fields of study are fringe, esoteric, and focus on the mystical. You may always handle Precursor artifacts safely. When you study an artifact or doctor a strange substance, you may ask one: what could this do? or why could this be dangerous?

SpecialAbilities.Name: Book Learning
SpecialAbilities.Description: You speak a multitude of languages and are broadly educated. Gain +1d when using study during a downtime activity.

SpecialAbilities.Name: Veteran
SpecialAbilities.Description: Choose a special ability from another source

Playbooks.ExperienceCondition: You addressed a challenge with insight or compassion

Heritages.Name: Imperial
Heritages.Description: Those with imperial heritage hail from Warren or the Core worlds. You were brought up educated in ways of the Hegemony, through a Guild vocational education, Cult teachings, or Noble family tutors.

Heritages.Name: Spacer
Heritages.Description: If you'd rather be more at home on a creaking ship, you could be from a spacer family. Ice miners, station mechanics, and most merchants are born, grow old, and die in space and may or may not view your terrestrial ventures with suspicion.

Heritages.Name: Colonist
Heritages.Description: The exact opposite are colonist families. Farmers, miners, and terraformers form the backbone of the Hegemony. Fighting for a living on the borders of planets, these folks deal with alien beasts and odd Precursor ruins more than most.

Heritages.Name: Manufactured
Heritages.Description: Manufactured families are fundamentally controlled in some way by the Guilds. For example, a Yaru clone who's escaped from a facility or a Urbot that's avoided routine memory wipes. You may often have to hide your origin and independence.

Heritages.Name: Wanderer
Heritages.Description: If you want to be without a planet to call home, you could be from a wanderer heritage. A small but notable portion of the Hegemony move from planet to planet, as opportunities emerge and galactic economic cycles shift. Or just follow where the Way takes you.

Heritages.Name: Xeno
Heritages.Description: Xeno families are as diverse as the countless kinds of Xenos in the galaxy. You were raised in a non-human culture. Xenos struggle to find acceptance in the Hegemony, and many of their practices are seen as strange or unusual.

Vices.Name: Faith
Vices.Description: You re part of a Cult, or observe specific ceremonies at regular intervals.

Vices.Name: Gambling
Vices.Description: You crave games of chance, betting on sporting events, etc.

Vices.Name: Luxury
Vices.Description: You seek the high life with expensive, ostentatious displays of wealth.

Vices.Name: Obligation
Vices.Description: You're devoted to a family, cause, organization, charity, etc.

Vices.Name: Pleasure
Vices.Description: You seek hedonistic gratification from lovers, food, drink, drugs, art, etc.

Vices.Name: Stupor
Vices.Description: You dull the senses with drug abuse, excessive drinking, fighting to exhaustion, etc.

Vices.Name: Weird
Vices.Description: You perform strange experiments, explore the Way, commune with Ur artifacts, and so on.

Backgrounds.Name: Academic
Backgrounds.Example: A professor, student, researcher, or other knowledge-driven vocation.

Backgrounds.Name: Labor
Backgrounds.Example: A factory worker, driver, dockhand, miner, or other tradesperson. The majority of the Hegemony is of this background.

Backgrounds.Name: Cult
Backgrounds.Example: Part of a Cult, officially sanctioned or not. A holy warrior, priest, or religious devotee.

Backgrounds.Name: Guilder
Backgrounds.Example: Involved in the of machinations of a Guild, such as a ship designer, financial analyst, or logistics officer.

Backgrounds.Name: Military
Backgrounds.Example: A Hegemonic soldier, mercenary, intelligence operative, strategist, training instructor, etc.

Backgrounds.Name: Noble
Backgrounds.Example: Living the life of luxury, such as a dilettante, someone caught up in House politics, etc

Backgrounds.Name: Syndicate
Backgrounds.Example: Part of an organized criminal gang, from the lowest lookout to ousted former crime lord.

Actions.Name: Doctor
Actions.ShortDescription: When you doctor, you attend to the needs of another by lending aid and comfort, or you look scientifically at the world.
Actions.LongDescription: You might treat someone s injuries. You might analyze a substance s composition to learn how it functions. You might comfort someone in distress (but consort might be better).

Actions.Name: Hack
Actions.ShortDescription: When you hack, you breach the security systems of computers or override their controls.
Actions.LongDescription: You might access a data console to find a captive being held somewhere on the station. You might scramble a drone s control systems to keep it from firing on you. You might override a door s controls to get it to open (though rig might be better).

Actions.Name: Rig
Actions.ShortDescription: When you rig mechanisms, you alter how an existing mechanism works or create a new one.
Actions.LongDescription: You might disable a trap. You might repair a damaged ship system. You might crack a safe. You might overdrive an engine. You might program a bomb to detonate later. You might force a door open (though hack might be better).

Actions.Name: Study
Actions.ShortDescription: When you study, you scrutinize details and interpret evidence.
Actions.LongDescription: You might gather information from documents, newspapers, and books. You might do research on an esoteric topic. You might closely analyze a person to detect lies or true feelings. You could deduce a person s intention to kill you (but attune might be better).

Actions.Name: Helm
Actions.ShortDescription: When you helm, you pilot a vehicle or use vehicle weapons.
Actions.LongDescription: You might plot a jump through a dark hyperspace lane. You might dive through a canyon to escape a chasing ship. You might fire quad-lasers at hostile pirates. You might reroute power on the ship to weather fire (though rig may be better).

Actions.Name: Scramble
Actions.ShortDescription: When you scramble, you lift, climb, jump, run, or swim, usually either away from or into danger.
Actions.LongDescription: You might vault over a turnstile while escaping authorities. You might climb up the side of a cliff to approach a secret base. You might dodge blaster fire as you cross the hanger to get to your ship. You might chase after a mark you re following (though skulk might be better).

Actions.Name: Scrap
Actions.ShortDescription: When you scrap, you engage in pitched combat with the intent to harm or neutralize your opposition.
Actions.LongDescription: You might brawl or wrestle with your foe. You might use a melee weapon. You might storm a barricade or hold a position in battle. You might lay down blaster fire. If you re using a vehicle or ship weapon, you should use helm instead.

Actions.Name: Skulk
Actions.ShortDescription: When you skulk, you move stealthily or without being noticed.
Actions.LongDescription: You might sneak past security or hide in the shadows. You might lift a cred-stick off a mark. You might sneak up behind someone to attack them by surprise (but scrap might be better). You could try to climb up the side of a building (but scramble might be better).

Actions.Name: Attune
Actions.ShortDescription: When you attune to the Way, you open your mind to the galactic energies underlying all of existence.
Actions.LongDescription: You might communicate with a non-sentient species or robot. You could safely handle Precursor artifacts or remnants that tap directly into the Way. You might sense unseen danger, or killing intent (though study might be better).

Actions.Name: Command
Actions.ShortDescription: When you command, you compel obedience with your force of personality.
Actions.LongDescription: You might intimidate or threaten to get what you want. You might lead an action with NPCs. You might order people to do what you want (though sway might be better).

Actions.Name: Consort
Actions.ShortDescription: When you consort, you socialize with friends and contacts.
Actions.LongDescription: You might gain access to resources, information, people, or places. You might make a good impression or win someone over with your charm and style. You might make new friends or connect with your heritage or background. You could try to direct your friends with social pressure (but command might be better).

Actions.Name: Sway
Actions.ShortDescription: When you sway, you influence someone with guile, charm, or logic.
Actions.LongDescription: You might outright lie to someone s face. You might persuade a sucker to believe you. You might argue the facts with an officer. You could try to trick people into affection or obedience (but consort or command might be better).

Xeno.Name: Xeno
Xeno.Description: You may spend stress (0-2) to perform an inhuman feat only members of your species can do.

Mechanic.Name: Tinker
Mechanic.Description: When you work on a clock with rig or hack, or when you study a schematic, fill +1 segment.

Muscle.Name: Unstoppable
Muscle.Description: You can push yourself to do one of the following: perform a feat of physical force that verges on the superhuman or engage a small gang on equal footing in close combat.

Mystic.Name: The Way
Mystic.Description: You can spend a gambit instead of paying any stress cost.

Pilot.Name: Ace Pilot
Pilot.Description: You have potency on all speed-related rolls. When you roll to resist the consequences of piloting, gain +1d.

Scoundrel.Name: Serendipitous
Scoundrel.Description: Your crew starts with +1 gambit when the pool resets.

Speaker.Name: Air of Respectability
Speaker.Description: You get an extra downtime activity to acquire assets or lay low.

Stitch.Name: I'm A Doctor, Not A...
Stitch.Description: You can push yourself to roll your doctor rating while performing a different action. Say which patient, research, or posting taught you this trick.
